body: hello @dgattiwsu, thank you for reporting this. the first step is to narrow down the problem to a minimal (non-)working example. What happens if you remove all Keras layers except for Input and Scattering2D?

**Issue #637. 
Thanks for identifying the possible bug. Yes, the problem appears also with the example script from the current kymatio release. All attempt to save the model in different ways point to the same `get_config` method:**

```
import tensorflow as tf
from tensorflow.keras.models import Model, model_from_json, load_model
from tensorflow.keras.layers import Input, Flatten, Dense
import json 
from kymatio.keras import Scattering2D

(x_train, y_train), (x_test, y_test) = tf.keras.datasets.mnist.load_data()
x_train, x_test = x_train / 255., x_test / 255.

inputs = Input(shape=(28, 28))
x = Scattering2D(J=3, L=8)(inputs)
x = Flatten()(x)
x_out = Dense(10, activation='softmax')(x)
model = Model(inputs, x_out)

model.summary()

model.compile(optimizer='adam',
              loss='sparse_categorical_crossentropy',
              metrics=['accuracy'])

model.fit(x_train[:10000], y_train[:10000], epochs=15,
          batch_size=64, validation_split=0.2)

model.evaluate(x_test, y_test)
```
_...
Epoch 15/15
125/125 [==============================] - 282s 2s/step - loss: 0.6652 - accuracy: 0.9266 - val_loss: 0.6579 - val_accuracy: 0.9100
313/313 [==============================] - 449s 1s/step - loss: 0.6451 - accuracy: 0.9271_

**Save architecture without weights as h5**
`model.save('model_arch.h5')`

_Traceback (most recent call last):

  File "/Users/dgatti/Documents/TEACHING/IBS_7140/IBS_7140_2018/ACTIVE_MATERIAL/TUTORIALS/PYTHON/Tutorial_PLOS/untitled1.py", line 87, in <module>
    model.save('model_arch.h5')

  File "/Users/dgatti/venv_jupyter/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/python/keras/engine/training.py", line 1979, in save
    signatures, options)

  File "/Users/dgatti/venv_jupyter/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/python/keras/saving/save.py", line 131, in save_model
    model, filepath, overwrite, include_optimizer)

  File "/Users/dgatti/venv_jupyter/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/python/keras/saving/hdf5_format.py", line 109, in save_model_to_hdf5
    model_metadata = saving_utils.model_metadata(model, include_optimizer)

  File "/Users/dgatti/venv_jupyter/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/python/keras/saving/saving_utils.py", line 157, in model_metadata
    raise e

  File "/Users/dgatti/venv_jupyter/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/python/keras/saving/saving_utils.py", line 154, in model_metadata
    model_config['config'] = model.get_config()

  File "/Users/dgatti/venv_jupyter/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/python/keras/engine/functional.py", line 598, in get_config
    return copy.deepcopy(get_network_config(self))

  File "/Users/dgatti/venv_jupyter/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/python/keras/engine/functional.py", line 1278, in get_network_config
    layer_config = serialize_layer_fn(layer)

  File "/Users/dgatti/venv_jupyter/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/python/keras/utils/generic_utils.py", line 250, in serialize_keras_object
    raise e

  File "/Users/dgatti/venv_jupyter/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/python/keras/utils/generic_utils.py", line 245, in serialize_keras_object
    config = instance.get_config()

  File "/Users/dgatti/venv_jupyter/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/python/keras/engine/base_layer.py", line 678, in get_config
    self.__class__.__name__)

NotImplementedError: Layer Scattering2D has arguments in `__init__` and therefore must override `get_config`._


**Save architecture + weights**
`model.save('model_all.h5',overwrite=True,include_optimizer=False,save_format='h5',signatures=None,options=None)`
 
_Traceback (most recent call last):

  File "/Users/dgatti/Documents/TEACHING/IBS_7140/IBS_7140_2018/ACTIVE_MATERIAL/TUTORIALS/PYTHON/Tutorial_PLOS/untitled1.py", line 92, in <module>
    overwrite=True,include_optimizer=False,save_format='h5',signatures=None,options=None)

  File "/Users/dgatti/venv_jupyter/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/python/keras/engine/training.py", line 1979, in save
    signatures, options)

  File "/Users/dgatti/venv_jupyter/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/python/keras/saving/save.py", line 131, in save_model
    model, filepath, overwrite, include_optimizer)

  File "/Users/dgatti/venv_jupyter/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/python/keras/saving/hdf5_format.py", line 109, in save_model_to_hdf5
    model_metadata = saving_utils.model_metadata(model, include_optimizer)

  File "/Users/dgatti/venv_jupyter/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/python/keras/saving/saving_utils.py", line 157, in model_metadata
    raise e

  File "/Users/dgatti/venv_jupyter/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/python/keras/saving/saving_utils.py", line 154, in model_metadata
    model_config['config'] = model.get_config()

  File "/Users/dgatti/venv_jupyter/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/python/keras/engine/functional.py", line 598, in get_config
    return copy.deepcopy(get_network_config(self))

  File "/Users/dgatti/venv_jupyter/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/python/keras/engine/functional.py", line 1278, in get_network_config
    layer_config = serialize_layer_fn(layer)

  File "/Users/dgatti/venv_jupyter/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/python/keras/utils/generic_utils.py", line 250, in serialize_keras_object
    raise e

  File "/Users/dgatti/venv_jupyter/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/python/keras/utils/generic_utils.py", line 245, in serialize_keras_object
    config = instance.get_config()

  File "/Users/dgatti/venv_jupyter/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/python/keras/engine/base_layer.py", line 678, in get_config
    self.__class__.__name__)

NotImplementedError: Layer Scattering2D has arguments in `__init__` and therefore must override `get_config`._

 
**Save architecture as json**
```
model_json = model.to_json()
with open('model.json', "w") as json_file:
    json_file.write(model_json) 
```
_Traceback (most recent call last):

  File "/Users/dgatti/Documents/TEACHING/IBS_7140/IBS_7140_2018/ACTIVE_MATERIAL/TUTORIALS/PYTHON/Tutorial_PLOS/untitled1.py", line 100, in <module>
    model_json = model.to_json()

  File "/Users/dgatti/venv_jupyter/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/python/keras/engine/training.py", line 2254, in to_json
    model_config = self._updated_config()

  File "/Users/dgatti/venv_jupyter/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/python/keras/engine/training.py", line 2221, in _updated_config
    config = self.get_config()

  File "/Users/dgatti/venv_jupyter/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/python/keras/engine/functional.py", line 598, in get_config
    return copy.deepcopy(get_network_config(self))

  File "/Users/dgatti/venv_jupyter/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/python/keras/engine/functional.py", line 1278, in get_network_config
    layer_config = serialize_layer_fn(layer)

  File "/Users/dgatti/venv_jupyter/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/python/keras/utils/generic_utils.py", line 250, in serialize_keras_object
    raise e

  File "/Users/dgatti/venv_jupyter/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/python/keras/utils/generic_utils.py", line 245, in serialize_keras_object
    config = instance.get_config()

  File "/Users/dgatti/venv_jupyter/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/python/keras/engine/base_layer.py", line 678, in get_config
    self.__class__.__name__)

NotImplementedError: Layer Scattering2D has arguments in `__init__` and therefore must override `get_config`._
@dgattiwsu OK, so now the question is what the `get_config` method should return in our case. Parameters only (Q, J, etc.) or the filters psi and phi too?

@lostanlen  Thank you again for the time you are spending on this. Don't know enough of Keras (and even less of kymatio) to make a sensible suggestion on what dictionary to put under get config. In the meantime, a reasonable fix seems to upgrade to the latest tensorflow and to save in tensorflow SaveModel format. This works for the kymatio example script:

```
import tensorflow as tf
from tensorflow.keras.models import Model, model_from_json, load_model
from tensorflow.keras.layers import Input, Flatten, Dense
import json

import kymatio
from kymatio.keras import Scattering2D

(x_train, y_train), (x_test, y_test) = tf.keras.datasets.mnist.load_data()
x_train, x_test = x_train / 255., x_test / 255.

inputs = Input(shape=(28, 28))
x = Scattering2D(J=3, L=8)(inputs)
x = Flatten()(x)
x_out = Dense(10, activation='softmax')(x)
model = Model(inputs, x_out)

model.compile(optimizer='adam',
              loss='sparse_categorical_crossentropy',
              metrics=['accuracy'])
model.fit(x_train[:500], y_train[:500], epochs=1,
          batch_size=64, validation_split=0.2)

model.evaluate(x_test[:500], y_test[:500])
```
16/16 [==============================] - 15s 949ms/step - loss: 2.2898 - accuracy: 0.2540


```
# Save as tensorflow SaveModel format
model.save('model_all')

# Reload as 'reconstructed_model'
reconstructed_model = load_model("model_all")

reconstructed_model.evaluate(x_test[:500], y_test[:500]) 
```
16/16 [==============================] - 19s 1s/step - loss: 2.2898 - accuracy: 0.2540
 
Although still fails (with a plethora of error messages) with the large model I work with.

> OK, so now the question is what the get_config method should return in our case. Parameters only (Q, J, etc.) or the filters psi and phi too?

If I understand correctly, all we need to save are the parameters that later need to get passed into `__init__`. For `Scattering2D` that's `J`, `L`, `max_order`, and `pre_pad`.
@janden Right. I suspect that we'd also have to write a `from_config` method which itself calls the `Scattering2D` Keras constructor, so that the model could be loaded back after being stored on disk

Great this looks like you have successfully identified the problem and a solution to it.

We should get this fixed at the latest by the sprint in February

issue.title: save kymatio configuration as a keras-compatible dict

repository.name: kymatio
repository.description: Wavelet scattering transforms in Python with GPU acceleration

issue.title: implement get_config in 1d and 2d

fixes #637 
a v2 of #659 with a ton of help from @edouardoyallon :)
